alert.note: Alert for Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 12:38PM MDT until May 31 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Elk River at Milner affecting Routt County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack upstream, increasing flow along the Elk River. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Elk River at Milner. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, lower portions of 42 road near the Elk River bridge are starting to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above bankfull this evening and overnight, with a maximum value of 7.4 feet by tomorrow morning. Then, water levels are expected to drop below bankfull stage and continue to decline. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
